column3: Hawaii Volcanoes National Park Management Plan
column13:
Says "The devastating effects of the park’s air tours
and aviation operations are centered over
the socially and economically disadvantaged
population of the District of Puna and the
Keaukaha Hawaiian Homesteads. Yet the
topic of Environmental Justice was dismissed
from this analysis. This is another violation of
NEPA requirements.”
Mentions low income groups but doesn't have a threshold, says people below the poverty line are more susceptible for disproportionate effects, but doesn't say if they do face them or not.
Says no impacts but doesn't give any details about any EJ community.

column10: CDOT will provide funding to the Community Resource Housing Develpment Corporation to assist in residential and buisness displacement. CDOT will provide 2 portable or window-mointed air contditioning units to residents close to the highway and assist in potential high utility costs. CDOT will provide contributions to existsing programs to facilitate access to fresh food.
column13: Says when mitigation efforts are put into effect, there should be no disproportionate impacts.
